description.narrative: Centre for Social Research and Development (CSRD) is a local non-government organization which is registered with the Hue Union of Science and Technology Associations (HUSTA). CSRD has been registered and operated since 2008. CSRD is based in Hue in the Central Region of Vietnam, and many of the projects have been located in the provinces of Central Region. CSRD also works throughout Vietnam and more broadly in South East Asia on water resources issues because CSRD is the administration center for the Vietnam Rivers Network (VRN). The CSRD mission is to work towards a better life for all people in Vietnam, particularly for those who are poor and vulnerable, and adversely impacted by Vietnam's industrial development. The hydro-power industry is a current focus because many power plants are planned and many are already operating. CSRD approach is to work in partnership with local communities and grass roots groups, and to bring communities together so that they may learn from each other. The organization contribution has been recognized by local and provincial authorities and by the National Union of Science and Technology Associations. CSRD maintains very good relationships with community partners; and has a positive record for achieving specific project outcomes.
